result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dewane J Mrotek

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant was in custody in Sheboygan County at the time of the hearing.  Court was not aware of this information.  Warrant not issued and initial appearance reset.

Defendant Dewane J Mrotek not in court.  Attorney Heather M Faeh in court for Dewane J Mrotek.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.
Arrest warrant authorized.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

Cash Bail Bond
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond
Brian Lieteritz: 310 Beechwood Street, Cleveland, WI 53015
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-10-22 at 1:30 pm in Branch 1.  Previously furnished recognizance bond is modified to $100 cash with all prior conditions. Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Non-appearance by defendant for initial appearance.  Warrant issued on State's motion.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of worthless check.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-14-22 at 1:30 pm.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with Menards in Manitowoc County.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 02-21-2022
